intro: Centrolepis cephaloformis subsp. murrayi, commonly known as Murray's centrolepis, is a unique member of the Zamioculcrataceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its compact growth and leathery, dark green leaves. Native to the tropical regions of Australia, this plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
